Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: Identify and draw different types of habitats such as a garden and a pond, showing both land and water examples.
Illustrate and accurately label a variety of living things in each habitat, like trees and squirrels in the garden and fish and clams in the pond.
Make comparisons in their drawing by showing how similar organisms might exist in different habitats (e.g., squirrels in both a forest and a garden).
Observe and represent patterns of plant and animal diversity, such as showing a greater variety of aquatic organisms in the pond.
Organize the drawing in a way that clearly demonstrates the distribution of plants and animals, providing a visual comparison of diversity between habitats.
CANNOT: May occasionally omit a label or slightly misplace an organism within a habitat (e.g., drawing a fish too far onto the land area of the pond scene).
Might inconsistently depict the scale or size of organisms relative to the habitat (e.g., drawing a very large ant compared to a tree, which could confuse the observer).
